collateral

catching non-convergent models

Charles T. Gray true
01-05-2019 

[1] "/home/charles/Documents/repos/measured"

I’m writing simulations at the moment, and sometimes the meta-analysis algorithm fails due to some kind of non-convergence. I think. I’d like to understand that better some time.

I think the collateral(Goldie 2018) package might be the solution to my problem.

I never did master this tryCatch1 business in the first place. So, at least there’s nothing to unlearn.

This post is a deep dive to see whether collateral can solve my problem and what else I’ll learn along the way.

I’ll start with the vignette.

Goldie, James. 2018. Collateral: Quickly Evaluate Captured Side Effects. https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=collateral.

  1. Is there a function to source the url of a function’s documentation?↩
